Class StudentRepository

java.lang.Object
database.StudentRepository
All Implemented Interfaces:
CrudRepository<Student,String>
public class StudentRepository extends Object implements CrudRepository<Student,String>
In-memory repository for managing Student entities.

This repository provides CRUD operations for student records and supports CSV-based persistence. Students are uniquely identified by their user ID following the format "U\d{7}[A-Z]" (e.g., "U1234567A"). The repository maintains insertion order using a LinkedHashMap for stable export order and predictable iteration.

The repository includes domain-specific query methods for filtering students by major and year of study, along with robust CSV import/export functionality with flexible header recognition.

    • loadFromCsv

      public void loadFromCsv(String path) throws IOException
      Loads students from a CSV file with flexible header recognition.

      The CSV file can use various column headers for each field:

      • Student ID: "studentid", "userid", "id", "student id"
      • Name: "name", "full name"
      • Major: "major", "programme", "program", "course"
      • Year: "year", "yearofstudy", "study year"
      • Email: "email", "mail"
      • Password: "password", "pwd"

      Validation and Defaults:

      • Student ID must match format "U\d{7}[A-Z]" (e.g., "U1234567A")
      • Invalid student IDs are skipped with an error message
      • Major defaults to "CSC" if not specified
      • Year defaults to 1 if not specified
      • Password defaults to "password" if not specified
      • Email defaults to empty string if not specified
      Parameters:
      path - the input CSV file path
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the file
      SecurityException - if file access is denied

    • saveToCsv

      public void saveToCsv(String path) throws IOException
      Saves all students to a CSV file with standardized column headers.

      The CSV file is created with the following columns in this exact order:

      1. StudentID - Unique user ID following format "U\d{7}[A-Z]"
      2. Name - Student's full name
      3. Major - Academic major/program
      4. Year - Year of study (1-4)
      5. Email - Email address
      6. Password - Account password (stored in plaintext)

      Parent directories are created automatically if they don't exist. If the file already exists, it will be overwritten.

      Security Note: Passwords are stored in plaintext in the CSV file. In a production environment, consider hashing passwords before storage.

      Parameters:
      path - the output CSV file path
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing the file
      SecurityException - if file access is denied
